meanings.definition: A person or thing that announces or signals the approach of another.
meanings.sent1: The robin's song was a harbinger of spring.
meanings.sent2: The dark clouds were a harbinger of the coming storm.
meanings.sent3: The barking dog acted as a harbinger of the mail carrier's arrival.
meanings.sent4: The distant sound of drums served as a harbinger of the approaching army.
meanings.sent5: The first snowflake was a harbinger of the impending blizzard.

meanings.definition: To signal the approach of something.
meanings.sent1: The distant thunder seemed to harbinger the coming rain.
meanings.sent2: The howling wind harbingered the arrival of the hurricane.
meanings.sent3: The ringing phone harbingered an unexpected call.
meanings.sent4: The smell of fresh bread baking in the oven harbingered a delicious meal.
meanings.sent5: The chirping birds harbingered the break of dawn.
